snippet: Some international couples are marrying by proxy over the Internet, a practice so new that immigration authorities say they do not typically watch for it in their efforts to detect fraud.
abstract: Some international couples are marrying by proxy over the Internet, practice so new immigration authorities say they do not typically watch for it in efforts to detect fraud; procedure had been used in United States, usually by members of military worried about being killed and leaving loved ones without benefits, but is also being used in immigrant communities, where people are seeking to marry partners from their homelands without expense of matchmaking trips abroad.
lead_paragraph: Some international couples are marrying by proxy over the Internet, a practice so new that immigration authorities say they do not typically watch for it in their efforts to detect fraud.

headline.seo: Internet Marriages on Rise in Some Immigrant Communities
headline.main: You May Now Kiss the Computer Screen
headline.print_headline: You May Now Kiss the Computer Screen
